laboratory_examinations.findings: The biopsy showed an infiltrate of mononuclear inflammatory cells that extended from the mucosalâ€“submucosal junction to the skeletal muscle fibers. The overlying mucosa was focally ulcerated. The mixed inflammatory infiltrate included histiocytes, lymphocytes, plasma cells, with numerous small blood vessels with plump endothelial cells. The biopsy contained clusters of epithelioid histiocytes, and treponemal forms were confirmed positive for T. pallidum.
Initial test was positive at a titer of 1:64.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat test showed a titer of 1:4.
